text: hello, to benefit this feature we need to install HubSpot package?

We have a client that we wanted to bring in historical sales data for reporting and we did just that, gave that data it's own sales pipeline.  Now we don't update any deals to change the pipeline but in your case you could do that so your approach sounds doable to me..

If you place a third party analytics script on your site, the script provided from that service will set non-essential cookies regardless of the user's HubSpot cookie banner preference.

This is why to properly manage third-party cookies within HubSpot, you need to conditionally load the scripts which set those cookies in the browser.

This means you can't implement typical instructions received from Third-party analytics/marketing service integrations. Do NOT simply place the <script> embed code they provide within the code of your site, because this is not conditional loading.

You can use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/events/cookie-banner|HubSpot Cookie Banner API> to develop a javascript file for your site, which can conditionally load your third party scripts based on the user's HubSpot cookie preferences.

By conditionally loading your third-party scripts that set marketing cookies, you can successfully achieve what you described: "decide in the code at which point the system can begin to collect marketing cookies"

Hi team, do you know if it is possible to embed a video hosted in HubSpot onto another website, such as our WordPress site, and include lead generation within the video?

I want to use HubSpot's "in-video forms" to capture leads directly within the video, where a form appears to collect viewer information while they're watching. <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/video-hosting>

How can I implement this? Is it an option only available on Hubpost landing pages?

There is this new feature that I have not tried but it might work. Content embed - <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/content/embedabble-content-blocks>

You need Content Hub Pro to use it.
